When we came in at the end of the night there was some guy (not an employee) lying on a mattress with the door open in a sloppy room just off the reception area, he rolled over and mumbled something and rolled back over and finished watching t.v. We enquired about the early checkout policy and Bernardsaid he couldn't respond and that we needed to speak with his co-worker. After going out New Years Eve we came in and asked the night deskclerk the same question and he said there was no problem, you pay for the night you stay. Needless to say, the following morning we got up and prepared to leave. When I called downstairs in the morning about checking out I spoke with a different person who got quite upset about us leaving. I conveyed to him what we had been told, he was very rude, we paid for our one night and left. We didn't know where we were going but we knew we were leaving that hotel! Twenty years ago my husband and I backpacked through Europe as broke students and we wouldn't have stayed in this dump back then. This is nothing more than a "flophouse". In the end it worked out fine, after walking a few blocks with our bags we got a cab and checked in to the Four Seasons for the next 4 nights. Now that it's over and we only stayed one night we all look back and laugh like hell at the dump and the crazy guy. The kids will always remember the "Soapoo!" What we have learned is that there are several hotels with similar names so make sure you book the hotel you mean to book (confirm the address) **THIS HOTEL ADDRESS IS ...75 rue St-Louis-en--I'IIe (4th Arrondissement). I also read the review in the Frommer's Paris 2008 book and it is extremely misleading. It is in no way a "charming family atmosphere" and as for offering baby-sitting...you would have to be crazy. I do regret that we did not think to take photographs because the photos we have seen didn't look anything like our 2 rooms. To top it off, when we returned we got an angry e-mail from Bernard at the hotel. Needless to say, we did not respond!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Amoureusedechats
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little hotel on the Ile St. Louis. The location is, of course, perfect. Right in the center of Paris. You can go in any direction for day walks and have a wonderful time. There are nice restaurants, all within walking distance. Our room was a "double twin" which is two twin beds put together. A very nice change from the usually smaller French beds. Which was very appreciated since both my husband and I are on the "larger" size. The bathroom was small but adequate. The rooms were kept very clean and the staff was very pleasant. The only suggestion I would have for this hotel is to decorate the rooms a little more. It would make a great experience into a totally "Parisian" experience. Do not bother with the hotel breakfast. Or maybe just once to see the little cave. You can get cafe-au-lait and croissant a lot cheaper at one of the cafes just a block away. All in all, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: pondfan1
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris during September and stayed for seven days at the Hotel Saint Louis. The location is wonderful, located on a lovely small island which is a terrific oasis to come back to after sightseeing. The hotel is an old small hotel; however with certain charms. It is not fancy; however, the deluxe double was of adequate size, although the bathroom was very small. The price of 140 euros for this location is a terrific inducement. The island is charming, with many restaurants and little shops. We especially enjoyed the Cafe St. Regis at the end of our street. Bernard, the day person at the hotel, was very knowledgable and helpful for us. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location!”
Reviews.Author: lezelsafi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Saint-Louis for 4 nights in March 2007 for our 10 year wedding anniversary. After reading Trip Advisor reviews, we were mixed as to stay here or not. We decided to chance it because the sheer amount of hotels that Paris has to offer is quite frankly overwhelming. We had our expectations set very low, not expecting the Athenne or George V but not a rat trap either. We arrived before 11 am on the day of our checkin after a "red-eye" flight from Dallas. We were warmly greeted and given the key to our room immediately! The reviews were right regarding the lift, it is small, but who cares, we took 2 trips with our luggage. We booked the top floor room, #51, and it was large for Paris standards. A double bed, 2 chairs, a desk, small closet, and an enormous bathroom with a tub that 2 people could fit in and you could still get 2 people ready at the same time in the bathroom. The room was extremely clean, the bed was very comortable (I slept the best I had in a year considering we have 3 little ones at home 5 yrs of age and under!), and it had to small step out balcones, one off the bathroom and one off the bedroom. The bedroom balcony offered a view of the Pantheon (which was gorgeous at night) and the Seine. Maid service came every day with fresh towels and tidying up the room. Oh, and the hot water (steaming) and water pressure were to die for after a long day of sightseeing! The Ile Saint Louis itself is a quaint little island with a couple of great brasseries, an amamzing crepeire and bakery (both directly across the street from the hotel!) We slept with the windows open every night because the island is so quiet at night (even after the island literally fills up on the weekend with Parisians shopping). One night there were some noisy drunkards wandering up and down the street, but we simply shut the window and could not hear a thing. We never saw another guest during our stay or heard another guest, though the walls appear to be rather thin, even though the hotel was full. Bernard at the front desk was extremly helpful with dinner reservations (Bofinger Restaurant) and even walked us around the corner of the hotel to give us a quick history lesson of the Pantheon on the hill and his favorite church, St. Etienne du Mont. He would even grab a map and draw the route we should take or Metro stop to go. EXTREMELY helpful overall was the entire staff. It is pretty bare bones, no mini bar, no room service, no Hermes bath products (only a combo soap in a squeeze bottle was offered), no amazing decor. But we paid 220 euros a night and felt we paid a fair price, as for the location (right across the bridge from Notre Dame, and the other direction across the bridge from Hotel de Ville, and several Metro Stops really close and the Les Cars Rouge bus stops right at Notre Dame, the cleanliness and it was an extremely safe area (no urine smelling dark alley entrance here!). We are already planning our next trip back and would defintely stay here again, though we did fall in love with the 6th arrondisement, St. Germain de Pres, and might give that area a stay. We cannot vouch for the size of the other rooms at the hotel or the breakfast (we always grabbed a pastry across the street and a cafe creme at Le Lutetia), but have no reservation about staying at this quaint, clean and safe hotel. Lezel and Rick Safi Edmond, OK USA

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a disaster”
Reviews.Author: Surlamer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a much anticipated mother/daughter vacation after researching Ile St. Louis online. I requested a room with TWO beds located on the top floor with a VIEW. I emailed and phoned before leaving the U.S. When we pulled up at the hotel, my daughter and I told the driver that no, this couldn't possibly be it. It looked too shabby. The lobby looked a little scruffy, but I was hoping for the best. I told the desk clerk that we had made a reservation for the room described above. He started making jokes. When we opened the door of the room, I couldn't believe it. A tiny tiny dingy room with one bed and no space to walk around on the 3rd floor with no view. We turned to leave, but the clerk told me that this was indeed a double. He pulled the bedspread back and we saw that it was two beds pushed together. He said that if we stuck our heads out the window and looked to the left, we would see the Seine. We felt sooooo conned! At that point, we had just crossed the Atlantic and were exhausted. We stuck it out. The bathroom was not properly equipped, the shower/tub was dangerous and we had no hot water for two days!!! As if this were not bad enough, we received a 6AM wake up call we had not requested. Were they trying to torment us? Never again. We finally left early, paying full price on a second airline because our tickets on Air France required a fine of close to $3000 to change, more than I paid in the first place. The Hotel St. Louis gave us a 10% discount for our inconvenience. Caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Hotel Saint Louis”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at two other hotels (Deux Iles and Lutece) on the Ile St. Louis. I wanted to stay again on the Ile St. Louis for my October 2006 visit, but I did not wish to pay as much as the other two times. I have been shying away from booking the Hotel Saint Louis due to the mixed reviews. But since there were a few positive recent reviews I decided to take a chance and I am glad I did. First of all the hotel's lobby is small but has enough seating for two antique chairs and a white leather sofa which is dirty looking and not appropriate, in my opinion, to match the ancient building the hotel is in. My room (#42) on the fourth floor was cosy but had enough room for a desk and chair plus enough walking room around the bed area. Fortunately it was a corner room so I had the advantage of having two large French windows which led to a small balcony which is really not useable. It's much too narrow to wander onto that balcony for safety reasons. Yet it was nice to have a balcony! I cannot understand why the hotel is rated 3* as the amenities offered are limited, but with the complicated hotel star rating system I suppose that's not surprising. Here are the pros and cons of my stay: Pros: Excellent location on the Ile St. Louis Very modern and extremely clean bathroom with a nice sized bathtub with wall shower attachment Friendly, helpful staff Room has individual a/c and heating Value is excellent considering the hotel's prime location (rate for a double room for one person is about 40 euro less than the other hotels I stayed at on the island) Cons: Above mentioned white leather sofa in lobby that looks dirty now and which the night clerk sleeps on. Tatty, old, faded bedspreads which are orange colored. They should be changed (one bedspread in 3rd floor room I had a choice of getting had a noticeable hole) immediately as they look awful. Extremely small regular double rooms as the bed takes up practically the entire room. Very very tiny bathrooms. For example, in my bathroom one could literally use the toilet and wash one's hand at the same time. Wall shower attachment is not adjustable. Hotel provides no soap except bottles of liquid soap that's meant to be used for multiple uses as soap, shampoo, and bath foam. Yuck. I brought my own bar soap as I hate liquid soap to use in the shower. There are no clothes hooks in the bathroom. Optional continental breakfast costs an additional 12 euro (didn't order) and is served in a vaulted room below the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “great location but bare bones”
Reviews.Author: oellen
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful. The rooms are bare, tiny and well worn. For the same price, I think we could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Saint-Louis in Paris. It was terrific little hotel charmingly situated in the middle of the Seine on Ile Saint-Louis in the heart of Paris. We booked this hotel on a recommendation from a friend and were not disappointed. You can't get a better location for touring the city - it's 5 minutes from a metro station, Notre Dame (you can hear the bells chiming from your room), the Marais district on the left bank, and St. Germain des Pres and the Latin Quarter on the right bank. There is a great ice cream shop on the island (Berthillon) and numerous cafes, shops etc. (note that they are a bit pricey b/c of the location so generally we ate dinner off the island where you get better value for your money). The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful with dinner reservations, directions etc. and were all very fluent in English (if your French is not). The rooms are small and compact but are very clean and charming and have everything you need. The bathrooms are also small but again are very cheerful (and seem to have been recently renovated), spotless and efficent. We did not find the street noise to be an issue and our room was facing the street. It's busy during the day and into the early evening but the bustle seemed to slow down by 9-10pm. I recommend having a drink at one of the cafes on the island overlooking the Seine/Notre Dame in the evening - a perfect place to appreciate the beauty of Paris and the lovely sunset. We also felt the hotel was well priced and good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Located in the middle of tranquility”
Reviews.Author: cpdh
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Paris this winter and chose the Hotel Saint-Louis based on its location mostly. We were not disappointed. Ile-St-Louis is such a calm center amid the bustle of Paris. There was something immediately relaxing about walking across the bridges from either bank. A village within the city, we delighted in the small shops, a handful of cafes and restaurants, and the proximity of the Berthillon ice cream! Research on this site had told us beforehand that Paris hotel rooms can be small, that these are sometimes cramped places with character instead of size and amenities. Consequently, we were happily surprised to find that our room on the top floor was kind of spacious. It seemed a simple room due to its decor - the fine floral prints and the exposed old beams - but it opened out onto a view of the rooftops with the Centre Pompidou just visible. The bathroom, I should add, was also nicely sized, and the shower had good water pressure. An especially pleasant thing was our arrival at about 9:00 on a gloomy morning following an overnight transatlantic flight. Our room was ready, and our bags brought up for us. We were able to unpack and rest for the remainder of the morning before setting out into Le Marais. That neighbourhood was just there, across the bridge. Getting around Paris by foot and Metro proved to be quite easy from our location. I hadn't intended my first trip to Paris to be in the winter, but it was wonderful just the same, and our enjoyment of the hotel was certainly a part of that.

Reviews.Title: “Je t'adore Paris!”
Reviews.Author: cadybugtours
Reviews.Content: Wow! After some dismal hotels in Italy, this hotel was a breath of fresh air. The staff was courteous and friendly (as friendly as Parisians can be), especially the support staff. The breakfast was fabulous and the location was optimal. The rooms were amazing and if we opened the window we could hear the bells on Notre Dame. The best crepes in the world are at a restaurant at the North side of Notre Dame and the hotel is just a few steps from it. Also close are fabulous restaurants and a grocery store where you can buy bottled water at a reasonable price. Paris is a second home to me and the Hotel Saint-Louis makes it even homier. I highly recommend this hotel for couples, business and leisure...not a very good hotel for kids but it is possible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely spot!”
Reviews.Author: joyciemc
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. I sent a few questions via email before our arrival, and they were always very helpful and quick to respond. Our room was small, but very clean with a nice, bright bathroom. Our window looked out on the street, and it was nice to hear the sounds of people enjoying themselves down below. It's an attractive hotel in a fantastic location.. I very much recommend it!
